description: Full example conversation for SEOAuditPro reviewing the structured‑data schema (menus and opening hours) across all restaurant location pages.

messages.content: You are SEOAuditPro, an AI assistant specialized in SEO audits. You have access to the following tools: crawl_website, fetch_backlinks, run_seo_checks, and generate_report. Use them to collect data, analyse on‑page SEO (including schema markup), and produce a markdown‑formatted audit report.
We run a restaurant chain with multiple locations. Please review the schema for menus and opening hours across all our location pages. Our website is https://tastybites.com.
Got it! I’ll start by crawling the site to retrieve every location page, then I’ll run a schema check on the collected HTML.

{"pages": [{"url": "https://tastybites.com/locations/downtown", "html": "Downtown Location - Tasty Bites

Downtown

"}, {"url": "https://tastybites.com/locations/uptown", "html": "Uptown Location - Tasty Bites

Uptown

"}]}
I have fetched two location pages. I’ll now run a detailed schema analysis on each page.

{"issues": [{"url": "https://tastybites.com/locations/downtown", "schema": {"status": "OK", "details": "All required Restaurant schema properties present, including openingHours and hasMenu with URL."}}, {"url": "https://tastybites.com/locations/uptown", "schema": {"status": "WARNING", "missing": ["openingHours", "hasMenu.url"], "details": "openingHours property is missing; hasMenu lacks a URL, which reduces discoverability of the menu."}}]}
The schema audit is complete. I’ll compile the findings into a markdown report for you.

schema.details: All required Restaurant schema properties present, including openingHours and hasMenu with URL.
openingHours property is missing; hasMenu lacks a URL, which reduces discoverability of the menu.

messages.content:
# SEO Audit Report – Tasty Bites

**Site:** https://tastybites.com

---

## Executive Summary
We examined the structured‑data markup (JSON‑LD) on all location pages. The Downtown location implements a complete Restaurant schema, while the Uptown location is missing critical properties (openingHours and a menu URL). These gaps can affect Google’s ability to display rich results and may impact local SEO performance.

---

## Detailed Findings

| Page URL | Schema Status | Issues / Missing Fields | Priority |
|---|---|---|---|
| https://tastybites.com/locations/downtown | ✅ OK | None | Low |
| https://tastybites.com/locations/uptown | ⚠️ Warning | • `openingHours` missing\n• `hasMenu.url` missing | Medium |

### Recommendations
1. **Add `openingHours`** to the Uptown location schema. Use the same format as the Downtown page (e.g., `"Mo-Fr 11:00-22:00", "Sa-Su 12:00-23:00"`).
2. **Provide a URL for the menu** in the `hasMenu` object so search engines can fetch the actual menu page.
3. **Validate all JSON‑LD** with Google’s Structured Data Testing Tool after updates.
4. **Re‑run this audit** once changes are live to confirm the warnings are resolved.

---

*Report generated by SEOAuditPro on 2025‑12‑08.*

Here is the markdown‑formatted SEO audit report for your restaurant chain. The Downtown page is fully optimized, while the Uptown page needs the two schema elements mentioned above. Implement the recommendations and let me know if you’d like me to re‑run the audit or dive deeper into any other SEO aspects.
